reviews.title: We'd stay there again.
reviews.text: If you're traveling to Tucson and want a great place to stay, give the Viscount Suite Hotel a try. The suites are very nicely layed out with new floorings, comfortable beds and lots of room. The free breakfast is excellent, serving hot food items. We are quite choosy in places to stay and would definitely return to the Viscount.

reviews.title: Great rooms and service
reviews.text: We have thoroughly enjoyed our many stays at the Viscount Suite Hotel.

reviews.title: Don't Even Bother
reviews.text: The staff isfriendly, the food is excellent and the rooms are spacious and clean. Even though I am a member of most of the major hotels' rewards clubs, whenever we stay in Tucson, I gladly give up those points to stay at the Viscount.

We had to find a hotel in quick order in Tucson and used Trip Advisor. We were very surprised at the size of the room- we were greeted by a large sitting room, a hallway with a bar sink, followed by a king sized bedroom. The rate of $99 included a hot buffet breakfast. We encountered few deals like this in our U.S. travels. Staff were helpful with instructions about driving directions and polite at the desk. The rooms were very clean. During our stay, an interstate high school football tournament was occurring and the desk wisely placed our room in a wing where there was no noise. No issues at this hotel, and thanks to hotel management for our good stay in Tucson.
reviews.title: This hotel is an incredible deal.
Great rooms and a great staff
reviews.text: My company uses this hotel quite often. Being unfamiliar with the Viscount chain, I was a little aprehensive about staying at the Viscount. Boy was I wrong. The place is a little old, but the staff and service more than make up for the need in updates. The rooms are huge (suites) and breakfast is included.

Upon checkout, I met Rodney and Joe, two supervisors that seemed to run every department. I think that they probably slept at the hotel. These guys did everything and have been working there since college. Joe and Rodney each promised a renovation after the 2006 season. I can't wait! Kudos to the staff for all of the service.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.text: We had no idea where to stay for a couple nights in Tucson as sightseers. We chose this hotel based solely on Trip Advisor reviews and were glad we did. Great place, great location, close to many restaurants, shopping, etc. The suites were large and suited us fine, though a little on the older side. The hot breakfast in the a.m. was great, esp. the made-to-order eggs/omelets. Wouldn't hesitate to go back.
reviews.title: Great place- Better value

reviews.text: It's hard to look through so many reviews for a city the size of Tucson and expect to get so lucky, but I did. The Viscount was GREAT. Better than I expected. There was a vast range in rates through the internet, but I tried the actual hotel site and lucked into an internet special. I saved near $50.00 on the room for a night. I only wished I had more time but had to move on after one night. When I get back to Tucson, I'll definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: This hotel is a gem!
Great stay at the Viscount
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very good. The omelets are made to order.

reviews.title: Best kept secret in Tucson
reviews.text: The suites could use a little updating but were large and had two TV's.

reviews.title: Loved the Viscount!
reviews.text: The pool area was very nice.

reviews.title: Great place to Stay
reviews.text: This hotel is centrally located with easy access to downtown, zoo, ballpark and a couple of the malls.

reviews.title: Will never stay there again
reviews.text: Overall the hotel staff was friendly. I would recommend a stay at the Viscount.
